The intervals between thermal-stress events were extracted randomly from a Poisson distribution, with values selected between 3- and 9-year intervals (Table 2), and the duration of each thermal-stress event was randomly selected from a gamma distribution lasting anywhere from 2 to 8 weeks over any given summer period. Because seasonal irradiance is unlikely to vary among years
39 , I ave was set at 45 in Equation 2 for all iterations. There was a minimal effect of the λ parameter (in Equation 2) on temperature increases between the years 2000 and 2010, therefore λ (Equation 2) was set to zero for the initial iteration (Table 1). The algorithm used for the model is available in Appendix 1; all the R code and the OpenBugs code is available in the supplementary document.
